void BtApplicationDeviceSearchRequest::OnRemoteDeviceName (  const BtDevice &  remote_device,
const WString &  remote_device_name
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Remote device name received message handler member function.

The OnRemoteDeviceName member function will be invoked when a BtRemoteDeviceNameMessage is received by this request. This member function is used to enable some reactions to the receipt of the aforsaid message.
The implmenetation of this member function is a dummy implementation and does nothing. If the application programmer wants to change this behaviour, he has to overload this function in a derived class. He need not to call the inherited base function, because it does nothing.

Parameters:
remote_device A reference to a BtDevice containing the device for which the name was received.
remote_device_name A reference to a WString containing the received remote device name.

Reimplemented from BtDeviceSearchRequest.

void BtApplicationDeviceSearchRequest::OnRequestStateChange (  BtRequestState  old_request_state,
BtRequestState  new_request_state
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Request state change handling member function.

The OnRequestStateChange will allways be invoked when the processing state of this request changes. This function is used to carry out some reactions to the change. It is an pure virtual function and all subsequent (inherited) requests therefore are abstract classes. So the application programmer has to derive the partikular request from the class that fullfills the request and must implement this function. After that the application progammer can use his request to initiate an request at the Bluetooth stack.

Parameters:
old_request_state A BtRequstState containing the state of the request before the change took place.
new_request_state A BtRequstState containing the state of the request after the change took place.

Implements BtLocalRequest.
